sanskrit_verse:
एकदेशं तु वेदस्य वेदाङ्गान्यपि वा पुनः ।
योऽध्यापयति वृत्त्यर्थमुपाध्यायः स उच्यते ॥ २.१४१॥
transliteration:
ekadeśaṃ tu vedasya vedāṅgāny api vā punaḥ |
yo'dhyāpayati vṛttyarthaṃ upādhyāyaḥ sa ucyate || 2.141||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who teaches a portion of the Veda or its limbs again for livelihood is designated as an Upadhyaya.
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent teaches any part of Veda OR Veda limbs AND does so for sustenance THEN classify agent AS Upadhyaya
IF classified AS Upadhyaya THEN ensure alignment WITH Vedic pedagogical standards
IF deviation occurs IN Vedic instruction THEN initiate consciousness-realigning completion process
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters concerning Vedic education or scriptural instruction, the threshold of responsibility lies in the conscious intent to transmit authentic Vedic knowledge. The Supreme Court must recognize that the role of an Upadhyaya carries inherent spiritual authority rooted in textual fidelity, not institutional appointment. Restoration involves realigning the instructor's capacity to preserve and convey accurate scriptural content.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is established through the demonstrable accuracy and continuity of Vedic transmission. Causality follows anupūrvaśaḥ: correct understanding leads to correct teaching which supports societal dharma. Responsibility is proportional to the instructor’s capacity and intent. There is no punitive consequence; misalignment necessitates guided correction and reintegration into proper instructional flow.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores the rightful position of the Upadhyaya within the Vedic order, aligns consciousness with scriptural truth, affirms non-punitive justice, and establishes reality as governed solely by awakened awareness.
